Article Title: What do new labour codes mean for employees & employers? From minimum wages, gratuity benefits to appointment letters & layoff rules
Article Text:
The new codes aim to increase women's employment opportunities, ensure worker safety, extend social security benefits to gig workers. (AI image)



Explained: How new labour laws could hit your take-home salary, increase your provident fund & gratuity contributions

These new labour codes will replace 29 existing labour laws. These codes are:

The Code on Wages, 2019

The Code on Social Security, 2020

The Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

The Industrial Relations Code, 2020

Result of Rationalizing Labour Laws

What should employees know about the new labour codes?

There will now be separate classifications for 'employee' and 'worker', with different benefits allocated to each category.

A 'worker' means someone who belongs to the 'workman' category from the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947, including individuals who perform manual, unskilled, skilled, technical, operational, clerical, or supervisory duties.

It excludes those in 'supervisory', 'managerial', or 'administrative' positions. Whilst the earlier legislation primarily addressed industrial disputes and retrenchment, the current definition has expanded considerably.

Workers will receive specific entitlements, including overtime compensation and leave encashment, as per the Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020. Regulations regarding working hours, annual leave, and standing orders apply specifically to 'workers'.

The codes bring in a unified 'wages' definition across all four sections. Earlier, multiple interpretations of 'wages' and 'salary' created difficulties in benefit calculations, which then resulted in inconsistencies and even legal disputes.

This 'wages' definition now applies to calculations for Gratuity, Employees' State Insurance, Leave Encashment, Overtime, Statutory Bonus, and other benefits. This standardisation aims to improve compliance through greater clarity.

Fixed term employees will get all benefits equal to permanent workers. This includes leave, medical, and social security. They will be eligible for gratuity after just one year, instead of the current five. Additionally, they will get equal wages as permanent staff, increasing income and protection.

To put it simply, gig workers and the unorganized sector will finally see social security benefits.

The new labour laws allow for companies that employ fewer than 300 workers to do layoffs and retrenchments without seeking prior governmental approval.

What are the key provisions of the new labour codes?

What do the new labour codes mean for employers?

Evaluate employment roles: Identify the employees who would qualify as ‘workers’ based on their substantial nature of work.

Identify the employees who would qualify as ‘workers’ based on their substantial nature of work. Assess the impact of the definition of ‘wages’ on employees’ salary structure: Review salary structure and benefits framework to comply with the new definition of ‘wages.’

Review salary structure and benefits framework to comply with the new definition of ‘wages.’ Analyze cost implications: Assess the financial impact of enhanced employee benefits on the organization.

Assess the financial impact of enhanced employee benefits on the organization. Reassess hiring models: Consider alternate hiring models in light of the provisions related to contract labour and fixed-term employment.

Consider alternate hiring models in light of the provisions related to contract labour and fixed-term employment. Align HR and Payroll policies: Ensure that HR and payroll processes comply with the labour codes and relevant state-specific regulations.

Ensure that HR and payroll processes comply with the labour codes and relevant state-specific regulations. Establish a robust compliance framework: Implement strong internal controls, conduct periodic diagnostic reviews, and ensure effective governance

New labour codes 2025: The government has introduced what experts are calling a significant reform in labour laws by implementing four comprehensive labour codes from November 21, 2025. The new labour codes impact both employers and employees. The new laws mean some big benefits for workers - universal minimum wages, gratuity benefits, social security coverage, provisions for women to do night shifts, recognition of gig economy workers, formal appointment letter requirement etc. However, some provisions also raise employment security issues.The new codes aim to increase women's employment opportunities, ensuring worker safety, extending social security benefits to gig workers, and guaranteeing timely wage payments, while establishing minimum wage standards.At the same time, the new codes provide businesses increased operational flexibility whilst maintaining regulatory certainty, particularly important given current global economic challenges. Outdated labour laws have in the past deterred foreign investment in India's manufacturing sector, with companies often favouring countries like Vietnam and Bangladesh for their production facilities.Government officials indicated that rules for the four codes - covering wages, industrial relations, social security, and occupational safety and health - would be implemented within 45 days.Following their notification by 2020, the actual implementation had remained pending. The government has now officially announced the implementation. Whilst the final implementation rules from central and state governments are awaited, they are anticipated to be released soon.As Arvind Panagariya, Chairman of 16th Finance Commission wrote in TOI, “The importance of the four codes lies in breaking the ice. For the first time since the launch of reforms, they have removed the first set of hurdles in the way of creating high productivity jobs in large numbers.”These consolidated labour codes aim to streamline the existing laws, enhance digital compliance, improve workforce management systems, and strengthen worker protection along with facilitating business operations.EY is of the view that the implementation of the labour codes is a significant and long-awaited initiative by the government. “These codes are poised to impact nearly every function within organizations, given the extensive changes they introduce,” it says.“However, it may also result in increased costs for organizations due to wider scope of the definition of wages. There are still ambiguities regarding coverage of different components of salary within the definition of wages (such as coverage of performance bonuses / one-off payments, etc.),” notes EY in a note on the new Labour codes.The new labour laws restrict contract labour usage in organisations' 'core activities', barring specific exceptions. Core activity includes the main purpose of establishment creation and includes essential operations necessary for such activities.Additionally, fixed-term employment has received formal recognition as a legitimate employment arrangement, but it is contingent upon some conditions and regulatory requirements.The regulations also authorise states to implement adaptable work arrangements. Certain states, including Haryana and Odisha, have incorporated flexible working provisions in their draft regulations, permitting organisations to implement four-day work schedules, notes EY.EY notes that the labour codes significantly affect various aspects of HR and payroll policies. “Certain provisions overlap with existing state-specific Shops and Establishments laws, which are not superseded by the labour codes, potentially leading to conflicts, especially concerning working hours, leave, and related issues,” it says.Organizations operating in multiple states may have to ensure compliance with both sets of laws in each jurisdiction. Additionally, since specific provisions apply only to 'workers,' organizations may need to implement different policies for various employee categories, it adds.The new labour legislation also authorises both the central and state governments to create and execute welfare programmes for platform workers, gig economy participants, and unorganised sector employees.This can include life insurance, disability protection, healthcare provisions, maternity support, retirement security and any associated benefits.For gig worker social security arrangements, platform aggregators are required to contribute between 1-2% of their yearly turnover to the social security fund. This is subject to 5% of the amount paid or payable by an aggregator to gig workers, to the social security fund.This is a change from the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947, which had set this limit at 100 workers. According to EY, the move offers businesses greater workforce management flexibility to adapt to market conditions.Additionally, the regulations also introduce a 're-skilling' fund to support any laid off workers in acquiring new skills. “For every retrenched worker, the employer is required to contribute 15 days’ last drawn wages (or any other amount notified by the central government) to a fund to be called the worker re-skilling fund,” explains EY.According to EY, It is essential for organizations to thoroughly assess the implications of these changes and prepare for a smooth transition to ensure compliance and operational efficiency. It suggests the following for organizations:The effectiveness of the new labour laws will substantially be dependent on state-level implementation, workforce education, and robust compliance monitoring.
Article Summary: The new codes aim to increase women's employment opportunities, ensure worker safety, extend social security benefits to gig workers. The codes bring in a unified 'wages' definition across all four sections. Fixed term employees will get all benefits equal to permanent workers.

Article Title: India growth outlook: S&P sees 6.5–6.7% expansion ahead; warns US tariffs still weighing on export sectors
Article Text:
Representative image

Piyush Goyal Calls India A Stability Anchor Amid Global Flux And Says The Coming 2 Years Are Pivotal

India’s economy is expected to remain firmly on a strong growth path over the next two years, with S&P Global Ratings projecting 6.5 per cent expansion in the current fiscal and 6.7 per cent in the next.The agency said a combination of tax cuts and monetary policy easing will bolster consumption-led growth despite the drag from higher US tariffs.As cited by news agency PTI, S&P noted that India’s real GDP grew 7.8 per cent in April–June, the fastest pace in five quarters.Official GDP numbers for July–September will be released on November 28. “We anticipate that India’s GDP will grow by 6.5 per cent in fiscal year 2026… and 6.7 per cent in fiscal 2027, with risks evenly balanced,” S&P said in its Economic Outlook Asia-Pacific report, adding that strong domestic consumption continues to support momentum.The RBI has forecast 6.8 per cent GDP growth for the current fiscal, compared to 6.5 per cent last year, PTI reported.According to S&P, securing a trade agreement with the US would help reduce uncertainty and lift confidence, particularly for labour-intensive sectors.It added that lowered GST rates , combined with income-tax cuts and interest rate reductions this year, will push consumption to play a larger role in growth than investment in FY26 and FY27.The government’s Budget for FY26 raised the income-tax rebate limit to Rs 12 lakh from Rs 7 lakh, providing Rs 1 lakh crore in relief to the middle class.In June, the RBI cut policy rates by 50 basis points to a three-year low of 5.5 per cent.Additionally, GST rates on about 375 items were slashed from September 22, making mass-consumption goods cheaper, PTI noted.S&P said elevated US tariffs continue to weigh on India’s export-oriented manufacturing, though there are early signs Washington may lower duties on some Indian products.The agency added that the US’s revised trade policy approach is forcing governments and firms to focus on securing exemptions, diverting resources from productivity-enhancing efforts.
Article Summary: S&P Global Ratings projects 6.5 per cent expansion in the current fiscal and 6.7 per cent in the next. The agency said a combination of tax cuts and monetary policy easing will bolster consumption-led growth despite the drag from higher US tariffs. Official GDP numbers for July–September will be released on November 28.

Article Title: Vande Bharat sleeper: When will Indian Railways launch the new train? Ashwini Vaishnaw shares important update
Article Text:
The new Vande Bharat sleeper train will look to offer superior comfort to Rajdhani Express trains on long-distance overnight routes.

PM Modi Flags Off Four Vande Bharat Express Trains From Varanasi, Says ‘New India On Fast Track’

Vande Bharat sleeper train: When will it be launched?

Vande Bharat sleeper

Vande Bharat sleeper prototype

Vande Bharat Sleeper Train: Top Features

The new Vande Bharat sleeper train has 16 coaches for passengers, including 11 AC 3 tier, 4 AC 2 tier, and one AC First class compartment.

The Vande Bharat sleeper train will be a semi-high speed, self-propelled train set, capable of 160 kmph speed, and a testing speed of 180 kmph.

The train incorporates advanced features such as specially designed night lighting, integrated announcement systems with visual displays, surveillance cameras, and modular kitchen units.

Built following European railway standards, the Vande Bharat sleeper aims to offer superior comfort levels with well-appointed coaches and padded berths. The design includes improved accessibility to upper berths.

Advanced bio-vacuum toilets, similar to those in aeroplanes, are installed throughout. The train accommodates disabled passengers and includes baby care facilities. AC First class sections offer shower facilities with hot water supply.

The indigenous KAVACH anti-collision technology safeguards these trains. They incorporate regenerative braking systems to optimize energy consumption.

The coaches feature automatic connecting doors between compartments. The gangways are fully sealed for a dust-free environment and temperature regulation.

Passengers will have personal reading lights, power outlets, tables for refreshments. The doors open automatically at stoppages.

A Centralised Coach Monitoring System manages amenities. Emergency communication links connect travellers to train operators. CCTV cameras monitor each coach.

Vande Bharat sleeper train launch: Indian Railways is looking to launch the first Vande Bharat sleeper train soon, with the first prototype rake undergoing changes after trial runs. Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has said that the aim is to launch the new Vande Bharat sleeper variant in December.The train has faced delays and after extensive trials of the first rake, changes have been suggested in the train to enhance passenger comfort. Vande Bharat Express has emerged as the new face of premium travel on Indian Railways. The AC chair car version, which is currently in service, caters to day travel needs. The new Vande Bharat sleeper train will look to offer superior comfort to Rajdhani Express trains on long-distance overnight routes.Ashwini Vaishnaw has said that the train will be launched in December. ‘Minor’ retrofitting work is in progress on the first Vande Bharat sleeper train to enhance passenger comfort, with the modified train set to debut next month, according to Vaishnaw.PTI quoted Vaishnaw as saying that after the trials of the first train, recommended modifications to the bogie and seats are currently being done. Vaishnaw confirmed that issues identified during the first rake's testing are being resolved in both the first and second trains.He explained that whilst the modifications are relatively small, they are being treated with significant importance to ensure optimal passenger comfort levels.“Changes are minor in nature, but we are treating them as major because we want to match the high standards of passenger comfort,” he said.Highlighting the focus on passenger welfare and safety, he emphasised their commitment to avoiding shortcuts to develop a quality product for future generations.According to the PTI report, BEML officials have confirmed receiving back the first prototype of Vande Bharat sleeper trains for modifications, following comprehensive testing and trials overseen by RDSO and the Commissioner of Railway Safety. The company is tasked with manufacturing 10 such trains."Since it is a prototype, it is very natural to test the train on all safety and comfort parameters. The first rake is back with us after intensive testing along with the suggested modifications," a BEML official said.The Railway Ministry officially approved the introduction of 16-car Vande Bharat Sleeper trains on October 28, whilst recommending specific alterations for enhanced performance in the future.The safety requirements include installing Arc Fault Detection Device for fire prevention, AC duct repositioning, CCTV fire-survival cable implementation and independent assessment of European fire safety (EN 45545) and crash resistance (EN 15227) standards, amongst other measures."Emergency alarm button and its indication sign board is found to be hidden behind the upper berth connector console and appear inaccessible to passengers for operation in emergency situations. This needs to be suitably relocated at an appropriate accessible location in the future production," said the October 28 letter.The ministry sent an additional letter on October 28 to RDSO and all zonal railways highlighting concerns regarding the train's interior finishing and construction quality.
Article Summary: The new Vande Bharat sleeper train will look to offer superior comfort to Rajdhani Express trains on long-distance overnight routes. The train has 16 coaches for passengers, including 11 AC 3 tier, 4 AC 2 tier, and one AC First class compartment. It will be a semi-high speed, self-propelled train set, capable of 160 kmph speed, and a testing speed of 180 kmph.

Article Title: NBFC growth steady despite risks: Crisil
Article Text: MUMBAI: Non-bank finance companies are likely to maintain growth in assets under management at 18%, despite a cautious approach on lending in certain buckets due to high customer leverage, Crisil Ratings said on Monday. The overall AUM for the industry is expected to touch Rs 50 lakh crore by end of FY27 on the back of a steady 18%-19% growth per annum."Exercising due caution on heightened customer leverage, NBFCs will adopt risk-calibrated growth, especially in the micro, medium and small enterprises (MSME) and unsecured loan segments," its chief rating officer Krishnan Sitaraman said. The agency said unsecured MSME business loans, which constitute 6% of industry AUM, have seen an increase in delinquencies amid higher borrower leverage and adjacencies with the microfinance customer segment. This will result in the AUM growth slowing down to 13%-14% from over 31% seen in the last two fiscals, it added.In the case of personal loans, which constitute 11% of the industry AUM, the growth is expected to improve to 22%-25% from 18%.
Article Summary: The overall AUM for the industry is expected to touch Rs 50 lakh crore by end of FY27. The agency said unsecured MSME business loans have seen an increase in delinquencies. This will result in the AUM growth slowing down to 13%-14% from over 31% seen in the last two fiscals.

Article Title: Card swipes go up, spends dip
Article Text:
Representative image

MUMBAI: Credit card usage rose in October 2025, when festival demand lifted the number of transactions even as the average ticket size fell dragging down value of transactions. Volumes increased 4.6% from Sept to 51.8 crore, but the total value of card spending declined 1.1% to around Rs. 2.1 lakh crore because shoppers made more but smaller purchases.PoS (card machine) use led the rise in October. PoS volume increased to 26.1 crore, and PoS value climbed to Rs 8.8 lakh crore. The shift reflects a return to in-store buying during the festival period, when households tend to buy clothing, electronics, and appliances at physical shops. Higher-value purchases at stores helped lift PoS spending after a weak Sept.Online spending eased with e-commerce volume rising to 25.5 crore transactions in Oct, but the value fell to Rs 12.6 lakh crore from Rs 14.4 lakh crore. The pattern shows that online spending remains tied to specific discount events. Without such offers in Oct, e-commerce value retreated even as volumes rose. The divergence between PoS and e-commerce shows how seasonal shopping patterns influence credit card use.Sept had shown the opposite trend. Card value rose 13.4% from Aug to Rs 2.2 lakh crore, driven by digital channels. E-commerce value jumped to Rs. 14.4 lakh crore in Sept, reflecting high-value purchases during online sales. PoS activity, meanwhile, dipped in volume and stayed flat in value.UPI continued to grow at a steady pace.
Article Summary: PoS (card machine) use led the rise in October. PoS volume increased to 26.1 crore, and PoS value climbed to Rs 8.8 lakh crore. Higher-value purchases at stores helped lift PoS spending after a weak Sept.

Article Title: India, Canada to resume trade deal talks: Piyush Goyal
Article Text:
AI image

'Double Trade By 2030': Piyush Goyal's Big Remarks As India, Canada Agree To Resume FTA Talks

NEW DELHI: India and Canada have agreed to resume talks for a free trade agreement (FTA), commerce and industry minister Piyush Goyal said on Monday as both countries aim to strengthen economic and trade ties. "We have agreed to begin negotiations for a high ambition Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) and double the trade between the two nations by 2030," Goyal said at a conference organised by Indo-Canadian Business chamber.The minister said a CEPA or FTA has many strategic elements and it's the demonstration of trust between the two countries. He said it gives confidence to investors, it gives confidence to businesses, to the provinces to engage with the two countries and the underlying theme of any such pact has to be mutual trust and respect.Goyal said message is that both PMs have sought to strengthen strong foundation of friendship between both vibrant democracies and trusted partners, working with each other over decades. "There is a lot that we can learn from Canada and a lot we can offer Canada. There is a lot of potential on critical minerals, critical minerals processing technologies. There is a good possibility on nuclear energy - particularly with our engagement with Canada on Uranium supplies," said Goyal, adding, "we can diversify our supply chains on both sides".The minister said Canada and India are natural allies and complement each other. "The strength of Canada and the strength of India together can become a force multiplier for businesses, for investors."Goyal said the recent meetings that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Canada's PM Mark Carney had, including the one at the G20 summit, clearly gives a direction for future of the Canada-India ties.The two countries had pressed the pause on FTA negotiations in 2023 after ties between the two countries nosedived over several issues and war of words between the two nations. India has been on a FTA signing spree and has wrapped up a major deal with the UK and there are expectations of an announcement of the trade deal with the US soon. Talks are ongoing for a deal worth the European Union. New Delhi has signed the terms of reference for resuming the FTA negotiations with Israel and a deal with New Zealand is also expected soon.
Article Summary: India and Canada have agreed to resume talks for a free trade agreement (FTA) The two countries had pressed the pause on FTA negotiations in 2023 after ties between the two countries nosedived. India has been on a FTA signing spree and has wrapped up a major deal with the UK.

Article Title: Delhi shrouded in smog: AQI remains 'very poor'; Anand Vihar hits severe 402
Article Text:
Delhi Air Pollution Protest At India Gate Turns Violent Amid ‘Madvi Hidma Amar Rahe’ Slogans

(With agency inputs)

NEW DELHI: A thick layer of haze engulfed the national capital on Tuesday morning, with the Air Quality Index (AQI) remaining in the ‘very poor’ category across Delhi and the NCR, according to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB).A dense blanket of toxic smog covered central Delhi, including the India Gate area.At AIIMS and Safdarjung, the AQI stood at 323, while India Gate recorded an AQI of 328 — both falling under the ‘very poor’ category.Anand Vihar recorded a severe AQI level of 402, the highest among major monitoring points.In the ITO area, a thick layer of smog lingered as the AQI touched 380, also in the ‘severe’ category.The air quality is likely to be in the Very Poor category from November 23 to November 26 as per the the Air Quality Early Warning System (EWS) forecastAccording to AQI categorisation, 0-50 is 'good', 51-100 'satisfactory', 101-200 'moderate', 201-300 'poor', 301-400 'very poor', and 401-500 'severe'.The India Meteorological Department said the minimum temperature was expected to dip further to between 8°C and 10°C on Tuesday and Wednesday, and the maximum was likely to stay between 24°C and 26°C until Tuesday and possibly fall by another degree on Wednesday.Earlier, a total of 22 people were arrested for allegedly blocking a road, obstructing police, and using pepper spray on Delhi Police personnel during a protest at India Gate on Sunday against the rising air pollution in Delhi-NCR.Delhi Police on Monday said two FIRs have been registered in connection with the incident — one at Kartavya Path Police Station and another at Sansad Marg Police Station.At Kartavya Path Police Station, six male protesters were booked under BNS sections 74, 79, 115(2), 132, 221, 223, and 61(2). The second FIR, registered at Sansad Marg Police Station, names the remaining protesters, who have been charged under BNS sections 223A, 132, 221, 121A, 126(2), and 3(5).
Article Summary: A thick layer of haze engulfed the national capital on Tuesday morning. The Air Quality Index (AQI) remained in the ‘very poor’ category across Delhi and the NCR. Anand Vihar recorded a severe AQI level of 402, the highest among major monitoring points.

Article Title: Tamil Nadu braces for Cyclone Senyar: Are schools shut on Nov 25? Heavy rain forecast for Nov 28–30
Article Text:
Cyclone Senyar

to Hit North And Delta Districts

District-Wise Rain Forecast

November 28:

November 29:

November 30:

Rainfall Measurements So Far

Tamil Nadu Schools Open O

n Nov 25?

Schools, Colleges Shut Due to Heavy Rain In Puducherry

CHENNAI: Due to incessant rainfall over the past three days, several residential areas in Thoothukudi district have been inundated with water on Tuesday, disrupting daily life.Similarly, heavy rain in Nagapattinam has flooded multiple houses, leaving residents struggling with stagnant water. Locals have urged authorities to take swift action to drain the water and restore normalcy.Several north and delta districts of Tamil Nadu are likely to experience heavy rainfall as the Bay of Bengal is expected to witness the formation of the season’s second cyclonic storm by November 27. The cyclone will be named Senyar, meaning “lion,” by the UAE.The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for very heavy rainfall (12–20 cm in 24 hours) on November 28 for three delta districts, November 29 for seven districts including Chennai, and November 30 for Tiruvallur.A yellow alert (6–12 cm) has been issued for southern districts on November 25 and for parts of the south and delta from November 26 to 28, before heavy rain shifts northwards on November 29–30.As of Monday, a well-marked low-pressure area with cyclonic circulation lay over Malaysia and the Strait of Malacca.It is expected to intensify into a depression over the south Andaman Sea by Tuesday and develop into a cyclone over the south Bay of Bengal within 48 hours.Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, Nagapattinam, and Karaikal may receive heavy to very heavy rainfall. Tuticorin, Ramanathapuram, Pudukkottai, Cuddalore, and Mayiladuthurai may get heavy rain.Rain is likely to spread to north Tamil Nadu, including Mayiladuthurai, Cuddalore, Villupuram, Chengalpet, Chennai, Kancheepuram, Tiruvallur, and Puducherry, with heavy to very heavy rainfall. Nagapattinam, Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, Ariyalur, Kallakurichi, Tiruvannamalai, Ranipet, Vellore, and Karaikal may also get heavy rain.Tiruvallur may receive heavy to very heavy rainfall, while Chennai, Chengalpet, Kancheepuram, Ranipet, Vellore, Tiruvannamalai, Villupuram, and Puducherry may get heavy rain.On Monday, parts of Tamil Nadu recorded notable rainfall, including Parangipettai (Cuddalore) 4.5 cm, Kanyakumari 2 cm, and Nagapattinam 1.3 cm till 7:30 pm. Light rainfall was recorded in Nungambakkam (3.4 mm) and Meenambakkam (0.7 mm).Over the past few days, heavy rainfall in south Tamil Nadu led to 22 weather stations logging 10–20 cm in 24 hours. Oothu in Tirunelveli recorded 23 cm, Nalumukku 22 cm, Sethiathope in Cuddalore and Kakkachi in Tirunelveli 21 cm each, and Manjolai 19 cm.Current forecasts indicate the cyclone may move close to the Chennai coast on November 29–30, though models differ on the exact landfall, with some suggesting it may cross the Andhra Pradesh coast or move northwards into the Bay of Bengal before weakening. There is no update yet on whether schools in Tamil Nadu will be closed on Tuesday.Normal life was disrupted in Puducherry and Karaikal as heavy rainfall continued on Monday. Schools and colleges were declared closed to ensure safety. Rain since Saturday caused inundation of several housing colonies and main roads, affecting daily commuting and public activities.
Article Summary: Several north and delta districts of Tamil Nadu are likely to experience heavy rainfall. The Bay of Bengal is expected to witness the formation of the season’s second cyclonic storm by November 27. The cyclone will be named Senyar, meaning “lion,” by the UAE.

Article Title: Cloud expansion: Amazon to invest $50 bn in US government AI infrastructure; AWS expands secure cloud capacity
Article Text: Amazon on Monday announced a $50-billion investment to expand artificial intelligence and supercomputing capacity for the US government, positioning itself as a central player in developing customised AI technology for federal missions.In a statement, the company said the initiative will give US agencies access to advanced machine-learning services, AI chips and software-development tools supporting areas such as cybersecurity, national security and scientific research, AFP reported.Amazon Web Services (AWS) said the investment will add nearly 1.3 gigawatts of computing capacity to its secure government cloud infrastructure. Construction of these high-performance systems will begin in 2026, and the facilities will be spread “across the country.”AWS, which competes with Microsoft and Google for federal cloud computing contracts, said the transition to AI is creating unprecedented demand for specialised, secure data-centre infrastructure.AI computing requires power-intensive, high-density data centres, prompting leading tech companies to speed up expansion plans.AWS noted that it already supports thousands of US government agencies, having built dedicated government cloud infrastructure since 2011, when it became the first provider to create systems aligned with federal security requirements.The announcement aligns with Washington’s efforts to maintain an edge over China in advanced AI capabilities.Amazon said the additional investment will strengthen America’s AI leadership by providing federal agencies with “the secure, scalable infrastructure they need for the next era of innovation.”
Article Summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) said the investment will add nearly 1.3 gigawatts of computing capacity to its secure government cloud infrastructure. Construction of these high-performance systems will begin in 2026, and the facilities will be spread “across the country”

Article Title: US markets today: Nasdaq jumps nearly 2% as Alphabet leads AI rally; rate-cut hopes steady Wall Street
Article Text: The US stock market moved higher on Monday as tech giants powered early gains and investors bet on another Federal Reserve rate cut in December, even as volatility continued to test sentiment.Alphabet was the day’s standout performer, soaring 5.2 per cent after fresh praise for its newest Gemini AI model. Its rally helped lift the Nasdaq composite by 1.7 per cent in early trade, while the S&P 500 rose 1 per cent and the Dow Jones Industrial Average added 144 points, AP reported.The advance came amid renewed optimism that the Fed will reduce its key interest rate next month, a shift that typically boosts equities. Traders priced in nearly a 79 per cent probability of a December cut, up from 71 per cent on Friday, according to CME Group data.But analysts cautioned that recent swings — the sharpest since April’s tariff-driven selloff — underline how fragile the market remains. US stocks have been toggling between gains and losses hour by hour as questions persist over whether AI-linked valuations are overheating and whether the Fed can ease policy without reigniting inflation.Tuesday’s wholesale inflation reading will be one of the week’s biggest tests, with economists expecting a 2.6 per cent rise from a year ago. A higher print could dim hopes of a December cut.Novo Nordisk slid 7.9 per cent after its Alzheimer’s drug failed to slow disease progression in a trial. Bitcoin remained volatile, hovering near $86,000 after swinging between $82,000 and $94,000 over the past week.Overseas, Hong Kong’s Hang Seng jumped 2 per cent, boosted by a 4.7 per cent rise in Alibaba ahead of its earnings. Article Summary: Alphabet was the day’s standout performer, soaring 5.2 per cent after fresh praise for its newest Gemini AI model. Its rally helped lift the Nasdaq composite by 1.7 per cent in early trade. The S&P 500 rose 1 per cent and the Dow Jones Industrial Average added 144 points.

Article Title: Gold outlook: Yellow metal retains shine as global uncertainty fuels record demand; HSBC sees continued strength ahead
Article Text:
Representative image

Gold is set to remain firmly supported in the months ahead, with HSBC describing the metal as a reliable shield against global volatility.In its Think Future 2026 outlook, the bank said gold continues to benefit from powerful demand both from central banks and retail investors amid persistent economic and geopolitical uncertainty.As per news agency ANI, HSBC noted that gold is on track for its strongest yearly performance in almost 50 years, rallying about 54 per cent so far in 2025.The bank described this as “one of its most successful years,” driven by heightened anxiety over global stability and concerns surrounding potential US dollar debasement.Prices climbed to a historic peak of $4,380 per ounce in October before easing as retail investors booked profits. Even after retreating to around $3,885, the metal has stabilised near the $4,000 mark. HSBC said gold “appears to have resumed its upward trend,” according to ANI.A major driver of resilience has been unwavering central-bank demand. The share of gold in global central bank reserves rose from 13 per cent in 2022 to roughly 22 per cent by the second quarter of 2025.Despite prices more than doubling, HSBC said elevated levels have not discouraged institutional buyers, who are seeking protection from “geopolitical conflicts, economic and fiscal challenges, rising inflation, and significant political shifts.”Their ongoing accumulation is expected to create a strong price floor.Retail participation has also strengthened, particularly through gold ETFs, which have seen consistent inflows since mid-2024. HSBC attributed this demand to the same factors driving central-bank buying — uncertainty, inflation risks and weakening confidence in the dollar — as per ANI.While gold has recently moved in step with equity markets, HSBC stressed this is a behavioural anomaly at high price levels rather than any dilution of its safe-haven role. The metal “is still a protective asset,” the report said.Expectations of more US Federal Reserve rate cuts, following delays in economic data caused by the shutdown, add further support.HSBC said this could lift prices further, although gains may be slower than before.The bank flagged two risks: a sudden hawkish shift by the Fed and a quicker-than-anticipated rebound in global economic conditions. Still, with uncertainty lingering and the dollar outlook fragile, gold’s bias remains upward, reported ANI.
Article Summary: HSBC said gold continues to benefit from powerful demand both from central banks and retail investors. The bank described this as ‘one of its most successful years,’ driven by heightened anxiety over global stability and concerns surrounding potential US dollar debasement.

Article Title: ‘Very, very optimistic’: Scott Bessent downplays 2026 recession fears; admits some US sectors remain weak
Article Text:
File photo: US treasury secretary Scott Bessent (Picture credit: AP)

Taiwan War Could Crash Global Economy As U.S. Warns Of 10% GDP Wipeout & Nuclear Risk

Bessent says inflation ‘has nothing to do with tariffs’ as U.S. rolls them back: Full interview

US treasury secretary Scott Bessent has insisted the United States is not heading for a recession in 2026, expressing strong confidence that President Donald Trump’s tariff strategy and new trade agreements will bring economic relief over the next year.Speaking to NBC News’ Meet the Press, Bessent said he was “very, very optimistic on 2026” and argued that the administration had “set the table for a very strong, noninflationary growth economy”.Bessent said the White House expects healthcare costs to fall and promised fresh announcements on that front this week.At the same time, he acknowledged that some parts of the economy are struggling, echoing earlier comments from National Economic Council director Kevin Hassett that interest-rate-sensitive sectors, especially housing, have been in recession.Bessent also pointed out that the 43-day government shutdown — the longest on record — had squeezed economic activity.A recent NBC News poll showed that nearly two-thirds of registered voters believe the administration has not delivered on the economy or cost of living.Despite this, Bessent highlighted Trump’s sweeping domestic policy package — the so-called “One Big, Beautiful Bill” — saying its various tax breaks and income-boosting measures are still kicking in and will support households next year.As per CNBC, the law introduces benefits including a larger state-and-local tax deduction, tax relief on overtime and tip income, and a senior “bonus” to offset Social Security taxes.Bessent blamed the services sector, rather than Trump’s tariffs, for ongoing inflation. He said lower energy prices should help cool inflation further, which currently sits around 3% annually.Inflation is running 0.5% higher in Democratic-led states, a gap Bessent attributed to “increased regulation”, reported Reuters.Hassett, speaking separately to Fox News, predicted that 2026 would be “an absolute blockbuster year,” although he warned of a “hiccup” in fourth-quarter data because of the shutdown.He said growth could slow to between 1.5% and 2% before picking up strongly next year.Bessent also defended the administration’s approach to the Russia-Ukraine peace push, telling NBC News that Trump is “a president of peace” and arguing that Europe's repeated sanctions packages had failed.He supported the 28-point peace proposal backed by the US, despite concerns raised by Ukraine, European governments and American lawmakers.Bessent further used the interview to urge Senate Republicans to end the filibuster if Democrats trigger another government shutdown, calling the recent closure a “1.5% hit to GDP”.
Article Summary: US treasury secretary Scott Bessent has insisted the United States is not heading for a recession in 2026. He expressed strong confidence that President Donald Trump’s tariff strategy and new trade agreements will bring economic relief over the next year. However, he acknowledged that some parts of the economy are struggling.
